surah_info.description:
Name
It is derived from the very first cord "Wat Tur-i."
Period of Revelation
From the internal evidence of the subject matter it appears that this Surah too was revealed in the same stage of the Holy Prophet's life at Makkah in which the Surah Adh-Dhariyat was revealed. While going through it one can clearly feel that during the period of its revelation the Holy Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was being showered with objections and accusations but there is no evidence yet to show that severe persecution of the Muslims had started.
Subject Matter and Topics
The subject matter of its first section (vv. 1-28) is the Hereafter. As arguments for its possibility, necessity and occurrence had already been given in Surah Adh-Dhariyat, these have not been repeated here. However, swearing an oath by some realities and signs which testify to the Hereafter, it has been stated most emphatically that it will surely come to pass, and none has the power to prevent its occurrence. Then, it has been stated as to what will be the fate of those who deny it when it actually occurs, and how will those who believe in it and adopt the way of piety and righteousness accordingly, be blessed by Allah.
Then, in the second section (vv. 29-49) the Quraish chiefs' attitude towards the message of the Holy Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah he upon him) has been criticized. They called him a sorcerer, a madman, or a poet, and would thus mislead the common people against him so that they should not pay any serious attention to the message he preached. They looked upon him as a calamity that had suddenly descended on them and would openly wish that he met with a disaster so that they were rid of him. They accused him of fabricating the Qur'an by himself and of presenting it in the name of Allah, and this was, God forbid, a fraud that he was practicing. They would often taunt him, saying that God could not have appointed an ordinary man like him to the office of Prophethood. They expressed great disgust at his invitation and message and would avoid him as if he was asking them for a reward for it. They would sit and take counsels together to devise schemes in order to put an end to
his mission. And while they did all this they never realized what creeds of ignorance they were involved in and how selflessly and sincerely was Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) exerting himself to deliver them from their error. While criticizing them for this attitude and conduct, Allah has put them certain questions, one after the other, each of which is either an answer to some objection of theirs, or a criticism of some error. Then, it has been said that it would absolutely be of no avail to show them a miracle in order to convince them of his Prophethood, for they were such stubborn people as would misinterpret anything they were shown only to avoid affirming the faith.
In the beginning of this section as well as in its end, the Holy Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) has been given the instruction that he should persistently continue giving his invitation and preaching his message in spite of the accusations and objections of his opponents and enemies, and should endure their resistance patiently till Allah's judgment comes to pass. Besides, he has been consoled, as if to say "Your Lord has not left you alone to face your enemies, after raising you as a Prophet, but He is constantly watching over you. Therefore, endure every hardship patiently till the Hour of His judgment comes, and seek through praising and glorifying your Lord the power that is required for exerting in the cause of Allah under such conditions.

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَٱلطُّورِ
surah_verses.en_text: By Mount Ṭûr!<sup foot_note=77430>1</sup>

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَكِتَـٰبٍ مَّسْطُورٍ
surah_verses.en_text: And by the Book written

surah_verses.arabic_text: فِى رَقٍّ مَّنشُورٍ
surah_verses.en_text: on open pages ˹for all to read˺!<sup foot_note=77431>1</sup>

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَٱلْبَيْتِ ٱلْمَعْمُورِ
surah_verses.en_text: And by the ˹Sacred˺ House frequently visited!<sup foot_note=77432>1</sup>

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَٱلسَّقْفِ ٱلْمَرْفُوعِ
surah_verses.en_text: And by the canopy raised ˹high˺!

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَٱلْبَحْرِ ٱلْمَسْجُورِ
surah_verses.en_text: And by the seas set on fire!<sup foot_note=77433>1</sup>

surah_verses.arabic_text: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ لَوَٰقِعٌ
surah_verses.en_text: Indeed, the punishment of your Lord will come to pass—

surah_verses.arabic_text: مَّا لَهُۥ مِن دَافِعٍ
surah_verses.en_text: none will avert it—

surah_verses.arabic_text: يَوْمَ تَمُورُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ مَوْرًا
surah_verses.en_text: on the Day the heavens will be shaken violently,

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَتَسِيرُ ٱلْجِبَالُ سَيْرًا
surah_verses.en_text: and the mountains will be blown away entirely.

surah_verses.arabic_text: فَوَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
surah_verses.en_text: Then woe on that Day to the deniers—

surah_verses.arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ فِى خَوْضٍ يَلْعَبُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: those who amuse themselves with falsehood!

surah_verses.arabic_text: يَوْمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا
surah_verses.en_text: ˹It is˺ the Day they will be fiercely shoved into the Fire of Hell.

surah_verses.arabic_text: هَـٰذِهِ ٱلنَّارُ ٱلَّتِى كُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: ˹They will be told,˺ “This is the Fire which you used to deny.

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَفَسِحْرٌ هَـٰذَآ أَمْ أَنتُمْ لَا تُبْصِرُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: Is this magic, or do you not see?

surah_verses.arabic_text: ٱصْلَوْهَا فَٱصْبِرُوٓا۟ أَوْ لَا تَصْبِرُوا۟ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: Burn in it! It is the same whether you endure ˹it˺ patiently or not.<sup foot_note=77434>1</sup> You are only rewarded for what you used to do.”

surah_verses.arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى جَنَّـٰتٍ وَنَعِيمٍ
surah_verses.en_text: Indeed, the righteous will be in Gardens and bliss,

surah_verses.arabic_text: فَـٰكِهِينَ بِمَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ وَوَقَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ عَذَابَ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
surah_verses.en_text: enjoying whatever their Lord will have granted them. And their Lord will have protected them from the torment of the Hellfire.

surah_verses.arabic_text: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: ˹They will be told,˺ “Eat and drink happily for what you used to do.”

surah_verses.arabic_text: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَّصْفُوفَةٍ ۖ وَزَوَّجْنَـٰهُم بِحُورٍ عِينٍ
surah_verses.en_text: They will be reclining on thrones, ˹neatly˺ lined up ˹facing each other˺. And We will pair them to maidens with gorgeous eyes.

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَٱتَّبَعَتْهُمْ ذُرِّيَّتُهُم بِإِيمَـٰنٍ أَلْحَقْنَا بِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ وَمَآ أَلَتْنَـٰهُم مِّنْ عَمَلِهِم مِّن شَىْءٍ ۚ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍۭ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٌ
surah_verses.en_text: As for those who believe and whose descendants follow them in faith, We will elevate their descendants to their rank, never discounting anything ˹of the reward˺ of their deeds. Every person will reap only what they sowed.<sup foot_note=77435>1</sup>

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَأَمْدَدْنَـٰهُم بِفَـٰكِهَةٍ وَلَحْمٍ مِّمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: And We will ˹continually˺ provide them with whatever fruit or meat they desire.

surah_verses.arabic_text: يَتَنَـٰزَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا لَّا لَغْوٌ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأْثِيمٌ
surah_verses.en_text: They will pass around to each other a drink ˹of pure wine,˺ which leads to no idle talk or sinfulness.

surah_verses.arabic_text: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ غِلْمَانٌ لَّهُمْ كَأَنَّهُمْ لُؤْلُؤٌ مَّكْنُونٌ
surah_verses.en_text: And they will be waited on by their youthful servants like spotless pearls.

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: They will turn to one another inquisitively.<sup foot_note=77436>1</sup>

surah_verses.arabic_text: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبْلُ فِىٓ أَهْلِنَا مُشْفِقِينَ
surah_verses.en_text: They will say, “Before ˹this reward˺ we used to be in awe ˹of Allah˺ in the midst of our people.

surah_verses.arabic_text: فَمَنَّ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا وَوَقَىٰنَا عَذَابَ ٱلسَّمُومِ
surah_verses.en_text: So Allah has graced us and protected us from the torment of ˹Hell’s˺ scorching heat.

surah_verses.arabic_text: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبْلُ نَدْعُوهُ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْبَرُّ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
surah_verses.en_text: Indeed, we used to call upon Him ˹alone˺ before. He is truly the Most Kind, Most Merciful.”

surah_verses.arabic_text: فَذَكِّرْ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِنِعْمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٍ وَلَا مَجْنُونٍ
surah_verses.en_text: So ˹continue to˺ remind ˹all, O  Prophet˺. For you, by the grace of your Lord, are not a fortune-teller or a madman.

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٌ نَّتَرَبَّصُ بِهِۦ رَيْبَ ٱلْمَنُونِ
surah_verses.en_text: Or do they say, “˹He is˺ a poet, for whom we ˹eagerly˺ await an ill-fate!”?

surah_verses.arabic_text: قُلْ تَرَبَّصُوا۟ فَإِنِّى مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْمُتَرَبِّصِينَ
surah_verses.en_text: Say, “Keep waiting! I too am waiting with you.”

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَمْ تَأْمُرُهُمْ أَحْلَـٰمُهُم بِهَـٰذَآ ۚ أَمْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: Or do their ˹intelligent˺ minds prompt them to this ˹paradox˺?<sup foot_note=77437>1</sup> Or are they ˹just˺ a transgressing people?

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُۥ ۚ بَل لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: Or do they say, “He made this ˹Quran˺ up!”? In fact, they have no faith.

surah_verses.arabic_text: فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِحَدِيثٍ مِّثْلِهِۦٓ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَـٰدِقِينَ
surah_verses.en_text: Let them then produce something like it, if what they say is true!<sup foot_note=77438>1</sup>

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَمْ خُلِقُوا۟ مِنْ غَيْرِ شَىْءٍ أَمْ هُمُ ٱلْخَـٰلِقُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: Or were they created by nothing, or are they ˹their own˺ creators?

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَمْ خَلَقُوا۟ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ ۚ بَل لَّا يُوقِنُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? In fact, they have no certainty.

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَمْ عِندَهُمْ خَزَآئِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمْ هُمُ ٱلْمُصَۣيْطِرُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: Or do they possess the treasuries of your Lord, or are they in control ˹of everything˺?

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَمْ لَهُمْ سُلَّمٌ يَسْتَمِعُونَ فِيهِ ۖ فَلْيَأْتِ مُسْتَمِعُهُم بِسُلْطَـٰنٍ مُّبِينٍ
surah_verses.en_text: Or do they have a stairway, by which they eavesdrop ˹on the heavens˺? Then let those who do so bring a compelling proof.

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَمْ لَهُ ٱلْبَنَـٰتُ وَلَكُمُ ٱلْبَنُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: Or does He have daughters ˹as you claim˺, while you ˹prefer to˺ have sons?<sup foot_note=77439>1</sup>

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: Or are you ˹O Prophet˺ asking them for a reward ˹for the message˺ so that they are overburdened by debt?

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَمْ عِندَهُمُ ٱلْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: Or do they have access to ˹the Record in˺ the unseen, so they copy it ˹for all to see˺?

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَمْ يُرِيدُونَ كَيْدًا ۖ فَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلْمَكِيدُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: Or do they intend to scheme ˹against the Prophet˺? Then it is the disbelievers who will fall victim to ˹their˺ schemes.

surah_verses.arabic_text: أَمْ لَهُمْ إِلَـٰهٌ غَيْرُ ٱللَّهِ ۚ سُبْحَـٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: Or do they have a god other than Allah? Glorified is Allah far above what they associate ˹with Him˺!

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ كِسْفًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ سَاقِطًا يَقُولُوا۟ سَحَابٌ مَّرْكُومٌ
surah_verses.en_text: If they were to see a ˹deadly˺ piece of the sky fall down ˹upon them˺, still they would say, “˹This is just˺ a pile of clouds.”

surah_verses.arabic_text: فَذَرْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَـٰقُوا۟ يَوْمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى فِيهِ يُصْعَقُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: So leave them until they face their Day in which they will be struck dead—

surah_verses.arabic_text: يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِى عَنْهُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْـًٔا وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: the Day their scheming will be of no benefit to them whatsoever, nor will they be helped.

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ عَذَابًا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
surah_verses.en_text: Also, the wrongdoers will certainly have another torment before that ˹Day˺, but most of them do not know.<sup foot_note=77440>1</sup>

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا ۖ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
surah_verses.en_text: So be patient with your Lord’s decree, for you are truly under Our ˹watchful˺ Eyes. And glorify the praises of your Lord when you rise.

surah_verses.arabic_text: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَإِدْبَـٰرَ ٱلنُّجُومِ
surah_verses.en_text: And glorify Him during part of the night and at the fading of the stars.
